metadata.description: Comprehensive test data for E2E persona-based testing of johapon_v01 (Korean union/apartment management SaaS)

P1_Methodical.name: P1 Methodical Admin
P1_Methodical.description: Systematic admin who follows processes step-by-step with only valid data

P2_Chaos.name: P2 Chaos Tester
P2_Chaos.description: Unpredictable user who tries boundary and invalid inputs
P2_Chaos.behavior: random clicks, unexpected input, back-forward navigation

P3_Newbie.name: P3 Newbie User
P3_Newbie.description: First-time user unfamiliar with the system
P3_Newbie.behavior: hesitant, simple inputs, may miss required fields

P4_Impatient.name: P4 Impatient User
P4_Impatient.description: User who clicks rapidly and does not wait for responses
P4_Impatient.behavior: rapid double-clicks, does not wait for loading, rapid navigation

P5_Perfectionist.name: P5 Perfectionist User
P5_Perfectionist.description: User who fills every field completely and correctly
P5_Perfectionist.behavior: fills all optional fields, reads every label, validates own input

P6_Malicious.name: P6 Malicious Admin
P6_Malicious.description: Attacker attempting SQL injection, XSS, auth bypass, privilege escalation

P7_Mobile.name: P7 Mobile User
P7_Mobile.description: User on a mobile device with limited screen space
P7_Mobile.behavior: short inputs, touch interactions, portrait orientation

P8_PowerUser.name: P8 Power User
P8_PowerUser.description: Experienced user performing bulk operations and large datasets
P8_PowerUser.behavior: large batch operations, pagination stress, search filters

P9_A11y.name: P9 Accessibility User
P9_A11y.description: User relying on keyboard navigation and screen readers
P9_A11y.behavior: tab navigation, ARIA labels, focus management, ESC key

P10_International.name: P10 International Guest
P10_International.description: Guest user with multilingual input and access token
P10_International.behavior: multilingual input, different character sets, access token usage

boundary._note: Token with 0 max usage - should be immediately exhausted

malicious._note: Attempt to use fabricated token key

invalid._note: Attempt to delete primary property unit (BR-009)

auth_bypass_attempts._note: Guessed internal API key - should fail
Non-admin trying admin endpoint - should return 403
Non-admin trying SMS send - should return 403

csrf_attempts._note: CSRF with mismatched Origin - should be blocked
Missing Origin header on DELETE - should be blocked

P1_Methodical.description: Uses only valid data, follows workflows sequentially

P2_Chaos.description: Mixes boundary, invalid, and random valid data unpredictably

P3_Newbie.description: Uses simple valid data, may leave optional fields empty

P4_Impatient.description: Uses valid data but performs rapid actions (double-clicks, rapid navigation)

P5_Perfectionist.description: Fills every single field including all optional ones

P6_Malicious.description: Uses all malicious and invalid data, probes for vulnerabilities

P7_Mobile.description: Uses short, simple valid data suitable for mobile input

P8_PowerUser.description: Large datasets, extensive search, pagination stress

P9_A11y.description: Standard valid data, focus on keyboard navigation and ARIA

P10_International.description: Multilingual data with access token for guest access
